After the death of his father in a car accident, Kale Brecht becomes 
a troublemaker and aggressive teenager. When he punches his Spanish 
teacher at school, he is sentenced to three months of house-arrest 
during his vacations. Kale snoops his neighbors with a binoculars 
and video camera for killing time, and becomes a voyeur of his next 
door neighbor Ashley Carlson. When Ashley sees Kale and his friend 
Ronnie at the window, he tells out of the blue that their neighbor 
Robert Turner seems to be a wanted serial killer from Austin, Texas. 
The trio sneaks around his house, and Kale begins to suspect that Mr. 
Turner might really be the murderer.
